revised_title: Life-history Costs and Evolution of Insecticide Resistance in Obliquebanded Leafroller
tldr: This study investigates the impact of insecticide resistance on the life-history traits of the obliquebanded leafroller, Choristoneura rosaceana. Results show that resistant populations have lower 16-day larval mass, smaller pupal mass, and longer development time, indicating that insecticide resistance is associated with life-history costs. This suggests that alternating insecticides to which the obliquebanded leafroller is not resistant could be a valuable strategy for managing this species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
